revised_title: Relativistic Effects in Electron-Atom Scattering: Breit-Pauli Approximation
tldr: The author presents a theory of electron-atom scattering using the Breit-Pauli approximation, which accounts for relativistic effects in the interaction between the colliding electron and the target. The study focuses on understanding the various terms of the Breit-Pauli Hamiltonian and their impact on total collision strengths. The author also discusses the challenges and potential applications of this approach in the field of atomic physics.
